title: The Strange Tale of Jefferson's Mammoth Cheese

media:group.media:title: The Strange Tale of Jefferson's Mammoth Cheese
media:group.media:description:
The birth of America. Palaeontology. Oversized dairy products. Believe it or not, there's a connection. Even more bizarre, it shines a new light on the American mindset.

Join me as I delve into Thomas Jefferson's mammoth obsession and a whole load of related topics. Too many related topics, probably. This video started with one fact but I kept digging my own rabbit hole of historical weirdness. Hopefully the end result is fun enough to justify its lack of direction.

Join my Discord server to discuss this video and more: https://discord.gg/AVcU9w5gVW
Follow me on Twitter for video updates: https://twitter.com/oliveriver_555

------------------

SOURCES

This video began with the story of Jefferson's mammoth obsession described in The Rise and Reign of the Mammals by Steve Brusatte. It's an excellent book and has my strongest recommendation. Other sources are given below.

The Louisiana Purchase:
https://www.history.com/topics/westward-expansion/louisiana-purchase
https://www.smithsonianmag.com/history/how-the-louisiana-purchase-changed-the-world-79715124/

More on Jefferson, Buffon, American Degeneracy and mammoths:
https://www.atlasobscura.com/articles/thomas-jefferson-built-this-country-on-mastodons
https://www.mentalfloss.com/article/573995/thomas-jefferson-mastodon-obsession-fueled-lewis-and-clark-expedition
https://www.npr.org/sections/krulwich/2014/01/15/262916045/thomas-jefferson-needs-a-dead-moose-right-now-to-defend-america?t=1661969353123
https://www.austintexas.gov/sites/default/files/files/Water/CER/American_natural_history_and_degenerate_nature_May_2014web.pdf
https://evolution-outreach.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12052-019-0107-0

The mammoth cheese:
https://www.monticello.org/research-education/thomas-jefferson-encyclopedia/mammoth-cheese/
https://wiltonhistorical.org/2017/09/thomas-jefferson-mammoth-cheese/

Stono slaves and the first American mammoth fossils:
https://weeklyhubris.com/slaves-first-identified-elephant-fossils-in-america/

The Haitian Revolution and further context:
http://www.ncsociology.org/torchmagazine/v911/Lore.pdf
https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/07/world/americas/haiti-poverty-history.html

More on Buffon and Lewis and Clark:
A Short History of Nearly Everything - Bill Bryson

More on mammoths:
Dinosaurs and Other Prehistoric Creatures - Dougal Dixon

Fourier and his heat addiction:
The Music of the Primes - Marcus du Sautoy

Kant and American Degeneracy:
https://philarchive.org/archive/LUAKAS
